channel.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
channel.description:
Well we have all heard of Swine Flu 2012 and what not. But what if 2012 is already happening? What if the world will end in 2012 but by the SWINE flu. It has already killed a few people and a few more years if we can't find something to stop it it could become something more powerful.
I would like to hear your opinions on this.

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:119, topic:276821”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=365480.msg3099855#msg3099855 date=1263638236]

The swine flu is no worse than the regular flu.

Don’t hold your breath on that.
[/quote]
i dunno wut u mean by that, but i had swine flu and its a fucking joke[/quote]
It’s not the actual disease itself. It affects people differently, some people are hit very hard by it, others just for reasons unknown don’t suffer nowhere near enough. I posted that when I thought Swine flu was the reason I was sent home from Kapooka, only to find out it was glandular fever.

Read full topic

[/quote]

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @noobie22 Noobie22
item.description:
@noobie22 wrote:

It’s not a pandemic yet.

I heard it’s 267 people now?

It’s been 3 months(April to now)

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

dragonfire455:

55,867 people were totally infected; just look at the common cold or AIDS / HIV. Those are pandemics. A mere 238+ deaths isn’t a pandemic. It DOES have the potential to be one; but I don’t expect that to happen.

The fact the number that was infected in England doubled on one week makes it dangerous.

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The WHO said it’s a pandemic. It is. AIDS/HIV is a disease that only spreads by transfer of body fluids. Mexican flu spreads like any flu, which means it is able to cause a pandemic.

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

No, I take the vaccine twice so I don’t think so, I was more thinking about the AIDS medicine that I have heard is very expensive if you don’t make it self.

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @wayzey wayzey
item.description:
@wayzey wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:105, topic:276821”][quote author=wayzey link=topic=365480.msg2815328#msg2815328 date=1244247701]

Yea but how great is that free health care?

Just to respond to fact 10: that has nothing to do with the health care you receive. The US is more then twice the size of any single European country. Because of that, the universities/etc have more money on their hands to experiment with new kinds of treatments.

Oh and Americans are twice the size compared to Europeans. Health begins at McDonalds (by not going there).

You forgot that US have 4 times bigger GDP than Germany(Richest country in Europe) so it even make the statement in fact 10 worse.

And comparing Europe to USA, Europe earns 1.3x what USA does and overall it’s smaller in land size and population. Your claim isn’t a very good one.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)

The countries in Europe are spending their money in their country so you don’t get any super universities that whole Europe pays in, and since US don’t use money as much money in the health sector they have more money for research.

Found out that the number I gave you was a little wrong.
Germany expenses are half of US expenses, but US still have much more money to use.

Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government_budget_by_country

Actually they spend that money on the military probably. You have to remember that if they find say a cure for cancer because of research then the whole world gets it and not just USA and you have no evidence to prove they they spend most on technological advancements or research so unless you do you can’t say that instead of spending money on health care they put it into research. You don’t know that.

[img]http://wwwimage.wallstrip.com/moblogic/_blog-bin/blog_chart1.jpg[img]
[/quote]
I did not say it, I just say they can use more money since they take up loans and don’t spend much on health care they had more money for other things, I did not say what they used their money for.

Anyway are you sure the whole world would get the cure? or would they just sell it expensive so only rich people could get it?[/quote]

Look at polio, look at small pox did America sell the cures so only rich people could get the cure?

Read full topic

item.title: Swine Flu-coincidence or not?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:101, topic:276821”][quote author=Niall link=topic=365480.msg2813952#msg2813952 date=1244159675]

Haaahaa, Americans doesn’t get free health care. Losers.

Yea but how great is that free health care?

…and look at how many people don’t have health insurance in the USA, or the people that cannot afford medicine due to it being several times more expensive than in other countries.
[/quote]

It’s ridiculously expensive. If I didn’t have a health insurance, I’d have to pay about €5000 just to get to hospital in an ambulance. Not to mention the costs of the rest of my health care. I saw a report on the US, where a family got a bill of about $20.000. If they all live by the ‘keeping up with the Joneses’ system, which most Americans do, they’ll have to get a loan to pay their bill, and increase their monthly pay again.[/quote]

Lol my grandma needed emergency surgery and it was going to cost $700,000 because she lives in Canada (she was in USA at the time), so doesn’t have insurance in USA. So they flew her by helicopter back to Canada, which costed $20,000

Read full topic
